verses.roman: ye mukti bhakta nā laya, se kṛṣṇa cāhe dite"

synonyms: ye—which; mukti—liberation; bhakta—a devotee; nā laya—does not take; se—that; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; cāhe dite—wants to offer.
translation: "Liberation, which is unacceptable for a pure devotee, is always offered by Kṛṣṇa without difficulty.
